meanings.definition: To make something more attractive by adding ornamentation or embellishments.
meanings.sent1: I will decorate the cake with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent2: She likes to decorate her room with fairy lights.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to decorate the living room with its toys.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to decorate the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The flowers decorate the garden beautifully.

meanings.definition: To furnish or adorn with something ornamental or becoming.
meanings.sent1: He will decorate the gift with a shiny bow.
meanings.sent2: They always decorate the Christmas tree with ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to decorate its nest with shiny objects.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to decorate her face with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The stars decorate the night sky magnificently.

meanings.definition: To improve the appearance of something by adding details or features.
meanings.sent1: They plan to decorate the house with new curtains.
meanings.sent2: The artist will decorate the painting with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to decorate his performance with silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to decorate the song with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight decorates the room with warmth.
